alert.note: Alert for Berks; Lehigh; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:54AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Sussex, Warren, eastern Berks, southeastern Lehigh, northwestern Montgomery, northwestern Bucks and Northampton Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 452 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near the Delaware Water Gap to near Birdsboro. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Forks, Emmaus, Quakertown, Wilson, Washington, Blairstown, Hellertown, Nazareth, Bangor, Pen Argyl, East Greenville, Wind Gap, Bath, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford and Alpha. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 37 and 56. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 55 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Berks; Lehigh; Northampton; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery
